oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of Three Therapeutic Methods of Cystic Ovaries in Holstein Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bolourichi, M.
Akbarshahi, A.
Niasari-Naslaji, A.
Hovareshti, P.
Tajik, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: luteal cysts
diagnosis
treatment
follicular cysts
luteolytic agent
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hormonal preparations that release luteinizing hormone from the anterior pituitary or have luteinizing hormone-like action are used to treat follicular cysts. GnRH belongs to the former group and human chorionic gonadotrophin (hCG) hormone is in the latter group. Treatment with a luteolytic agent, prostaglandin F2a (PGF2a), is successful if a luteal cyst is diagnosed properly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 283
